intro: Magnistipula cuneatifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf magnistipula, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in humid, warm climates. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
